answers.author: Rick White
answers.text:
I would highly suggest you look into the Institute for Sustainable Infrastructure’s (ISI) Envision system.  It is a sustainability rating system developed to parallel LEED for the full breadth of civil infrastructure projects.  ISI was founded by ASCE, ACEC, and APWA to develop a rating system applicable to all infrastructure projects, not just sector specific projects as some of the others mentioned.  Several projects in the U.S. have already received Envision Awards.  Below is a link to the website for more information.   
http://sustainableinfrastructure.org

author: Andrea Fox
text: The City of Fort Collins, CO is looking to develop a system that can be used to assess the sustainability of projects and programs going before City Council. To support the development of this system, the city is evaluating existing assessment tools and resources that are intuitive and accessible. They are looking for existing tools that can be applied to a wide array of topic areas while also considering tools that address specific topics. Does your jurisdiction use any sustainability assessment tools? Which tools are you aware of?
title: Sustainability Assessment Tools?
